navigation.paulWillContact: Paul will contact you to arrange payment

hero.title: Welcome to Our Virtual Workshop
hero.subtitle: Handcrafted bowed string instruments from the heart of Transylvania, where tradition meets exceptional craftsmanship.
hero.welcome: We are Paul and Ecaterina Simon and we are happy to welcome you to our site.
hero.intro: Our main field of activity consists of producing and supplying new bowed string music instruments.
hero.origin: Our little workshop, "our business", started in February 2014 in a small town in Transylvania, Reghin, known as "The City of Violins" due to its tradition in manufacturing bowed string music instruments.
hero.experience: Our first contact with music instruments dates back to 2001, when we started working in a company where the wood for music instruments was prepared. This was the place we learned to carefully select the best wood, which is an important step in manufacturing music instruments of the highest quality.

instruments.title: Our Craft
instruments.subtitle: Explore our four families of handcrafted string instruments. Each one tells a story of tradition, craftsmanship, and dedication.

story.title: Our Craft
story.subtitle: Together with our colleagues who have a vast experience, we manually prepare wood by traditional procedures, through dozens of stages for each instrument, aiming to obtain the nicest sound from each piece of wood.

heritage.title: Traditional Wood Preparation
heritage.description: In our warehouse the wood is kept and dried only naturally. We carefully select the best wood, a skill we've developed since 2001—an important step in manufacturing music instruments of the highest quality.

materials.title: Hand-Applied Lacquer
materials.description: In our workshop we pay special attention to the lacquering and finishing process of the instruments. We lacquer each instrument only by hand, with ones of the best lacquers, based on natural resins.

clientele.title: International Clientele
clientele.description: Our portfolio contains the whole range of string instruments: violins, violas, cellos and contrabasses. The quality of our products is appreciated by our clients and collaborators from countries like France, Belgium, Spain, Germany, Japan, Taiwan, etc.

story.invitation: We invite you to our virtual workshop...

testimonials.title: What Our Clients Say
testimonials.subtitle: Hear from musicians who have chosen our instruments

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our instruments and services
faq.contactPrompt: Can't find what you're looking for?

purchase.question: How can I purchase an instrument?
purchase.answer: You can browse our available instruments in the Shop section. Once you find an instrument you like, you can reserve it through our website. After reservation, Paul will contact you within 1-2 business days to discuss the details, answer any questions, and arrange for payment and delivery.

shipping.question: How does delivery work?
shipping.answer: We offer door-to-door service: your instrument is picked up from our atelier in Reghin and delivered directly to your address. Depending on your location, delivery may be via air cargo or ground transport. Every instrument is professionally packed and fully insured throughout the journey. The cost of delivery is calculated based on the size of the package and the distance.

returns.question: What is your return policy?
returns.answer: We offer a 14-day return policy for instruments in their original condition. If you're not completely satisfied, you can return the instrument for a full refund minus shipping costs. Custom orders may have different terms.

certificate.question: Do instruments come with a certificate of authenticity?
certificate.answer: Yes, every instrument we create comes with a signed certificate of authenticity that includes details about the materials used, construction date, and our workshop guarantee.

care.question: How should I care for my instrument?
care.answer: We recommend keeping your instrument in a case when not in use, maintaining proper humidity levels (40-60%), and having it professionally set up annually.

custom.question: Can I order a custom instrument?
custom.answer: We welcome custom orders. Contact us to discuss your specific requirements, preferences for wood selection, varnish color, and any other customizations you'd like. Custom instruments typically take 3-6 months to complete.

payment.question: What payment methods do you accept?
payment.answer: After your reservation is confirmed, payment can be arranged via bank transfer or other means of payment.

reservation.title: Reservation Submitted!

reservation.step1Desc: Within 1-2 business days, Paul will reach out via email or phone to confirm your reservation details and answer any questions.

inquiry.confirmationEmailDesc: We've sent a confirmation email with your inquiry details.
inquiry.personalResponseDesc: Paul or Ecaterina Simon will personally review your inquiry and respond with detailed information about the instruments you're interested in.
inquiry.consultationAvailableDesc: We can arrange a phone or video call to discuss your needs and help you find the perfect instrument.

order.shippingTrackingDesc: Your instrument will be carefully packaged at our atelier and delivered door-to-door to your address. Delivery and full insurance are included. You'll receive tracking details once your instrument is on its way.
